intro: Fistularia crista-galli, commonly known as the common spiny eel, is a marine fish belonging to the family Nemichthyidae. It is characterized by its elongated, eel-like body and a distinctive spiny dorsal fin that extends along its back. The species is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Atlantic, Indian, and Pacific Oceans. It typically inhabits coastal waters and estuaries, where it feeds on small invertebrates and fish. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to marine biologists and aquaculture researchers.
